# typescript/consistent-indexed-object-style <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule for some violations.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Require or disallow the `Record` type.

### Why is this bad?

Inconsistent style for indexed object types can harm readability in a project.

### Examples

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```ts
interface Foo {
  [key: string]: unknown;
}
type Foo = {
  [key: string]: unknown;
};
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```ts
type Foo = Record<string, unknown>;
```
